title: Best Ways to Watch Local Channels on a Smart TV (Free & Paid Options)

steps.title: NewsON.
steps.content: NewsON. Watch local news channels on nearly any smart TV or streaming device with the free NewsON app. You can check out the channel list at https://corporate.newson.us/newson-channel-list/ . Search your TV app store for "NewsON" to get started.

steps.title: HaystackNews.
steps.content: HaystackNews. This free news app is available in nearly all smart TV app stores, including on Fire TV , Roku, LG, Hisense, Android, and Sony TVs. Once you download the app, create an account and select Local News to discover what's happening in your area. You can also tune in using a web browser at https://www.haystack.tv/localnews .

steps.title: Local Now.
steps.content: Local Now. Watch local news and weather on your Fire TV, Roku TV, Apple TV, or Android/Google TV by installing the Local Now app from your app store. [1] X Research source In addition to local news, you can also watch free movies and TV shows from their large library.

steps.title: The Roku Channel.
steps.content: The Roku Channel. If you have a Roku TV or streaming device and live in a major metropolitan area, you can watch local news and weather from FOX, CBS, ABC, and NBC without installing any apps. Just select the Live TV tile on your home screen, or open The Roku Channel , press the Left button on your remote, and select Live TV . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Zeam.
steps.content: Zeam. The Zeam app, available on Android/Google TV, Roku TV, Fire TV, and Apple TV, offers local news channels from many areas, even small towns, and gives you the option to watch local news from regions other than your own.

steps.title: Channel-specific apps.
steps.content: Channel-specific apps. Search your smart TV's app store for your favorite channel. Many channels offer smart TV apps that allow you to watch live programming without an antenna. You can download apps from major broadcasters like CBS, NBC, and PBS, as well as smaller local channels exclusive to your area.

steps.title: YouTube TV.
steps.content: YouTube TV. This popular cable TV replacement service brings over 100 live TV channels to your smart TV without an antenna, including many local channels. [3] X Research source To see which local channels you can watch with YouTube TV, go to https://tv.youtube.com/welcome/ and search for your zip code. View plans

steps.title: Hulu + Live TV.
steps.content: Hulu + Live TV. A subscription gets you access to everything in Hulu's library, Disney+, live local channels without an antenna, and almost 100 other live and on-demand channels. [4] X Research source Find out which local channels you get with Hulu + Live TV at https://www.hulu.com/live-tv . View plans

steps.title: Fubo.
steps.content: Fubo. You can watch your local ABC, CBS, FOX, CW, Telemundo, and Univision channels with any of Fubo's base plans. [5] X Research source You'll have access to more than 100 other live channels and a cloud-based DVR service. [6] X Research source View plans

steps.title: Sling.
steps.content: Sling. Depending on where you live, you may be able to watch local channels with a Sling subscription without an antenna—to find out, go to https://www.sling.com/programming/local-channels and search for your zip code. If local channels aren't available, Sling will send you a free HD antenna when you sign up. [7] X Research source And with plans starting as low as $20/month, it's definitely the most affordable cable replacement service . View plans

steps.title: DIRECTV Stream.
steps.content: DIRECTV Stream. If it's regional sports channels you're after, DIRECTV Stream carries 30+ regional sports networks, as well as your local ABC, NBC, CBS, FOX, PBS, and other channels. [8] X Research source Visit https://streamtv.directv.com/channels/ to find out which local channels are available through DIRECTV Stream. View plans

steps.title: Paramount+.
steps.content: Paramount+. Subscribe to Paramount+ with Showtime to watch your local CBS channel live, as well as live sports and CBS News without an antenna. View plans

steps.title: Peacock Premium Plus.
steps.content: Peacock Premium Plus. Peacock's most advanced streaming plan offers 24/7 live streaming of your local NBC channel. [9] X Research source If you just want to watch NBC programming—including Saturday Night Live as it airs—Peacock Premium Plus is a great option. View plans

steps.title: Antennas aren't as big or expensive as they used to be.
steps.content: Antennas aren't as big or expensive as they used to be. All TVs manufactured after 2007 have built-in digital tuners, which means all you'll need to do is connect a small indoor antenna to the TV to watch all your area's local programming. [10] X Trustworthy Source Federal Communications Commission Independent U.S. government agency responsible for regulating radio, television, and satellite, and phone communications Go to source While you may picture having to mount a giant antenna or dish outside your home to receive local channels over the air, modern digital antennas can easily be connected to your smart TV, and some can even pick up TV stations from nearly 1000 miles away. You can find tons of smart TV antennas on Amazon at various price points, starting as low as $10.
